title: [Self-Directed] Cognitive Load Measurement and Optimization in VR Simulation Training

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in VR device operation and foundational health-related knowledge
context.additional_context: Learners participate in VR simulations via personal mobile devices; cognitive load is analyzed through real-time eye-tracking technology. The training gradually increases task difficulty in health management scenarios.

learning_goals: Learners can measure cognitive load changes based on task difficulty in VR simulation environments using TEPRs (pupillary light reflex-corrected values).

Learners must compare cognitive load data (e.g., NASA-TLX scores) and self-assessment results (5-point scale) collected during training, write an analysis report, and improve the training plan in ≥2 ways based on findings.

Learners must analyze the correlation between performance metrics (task completion time, error rate) and cognitive load indicators (heart rate variability, survey scores) in VR-based simulations, propose ≥3 training strategy adjustments, and apply them to actual training scenarios.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
